data.title: Hopeful
data.text: The Guiness BBQ Meatballs were pretty good. The nachos were just ok. There was not anything wrong with the nachos, they just were ordinary. Their craft beer selection MUST be improved if they want to make it, imho. Their menu needs to have a few outstanding items. They are owned by Othello's, so they know something about running a successful restaurant. However, it seems that from the decor, to the food and beer selection, they just are not trying very hard. I am hopeful they will put forth the effort and succeed.

data.title: Please check out this friendly fun sports bar! Delicious food and HUGE tv's!
data.text: Dropped in here on a whim for a late lunch and was delighted! Varied menu, we ordered the bacon cheeseburger and sweet potato fries and turkey burger. Delicious with friendly fast service. Biggest sports screens I've ever seen and a great seating area for families. Make The Zu your next stop for lunch when you're in downtown Edmond!

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: This was my first visit to this fairly  ew sports bar and grill in downtown Edmond. Not a big fan of the fried food fare, but this was tasty. the Pulled chicken and slaw sandwich with the french fried twists was very tasty. Washed it down with a Moose Drool beer, and was stuffed. Great food, service and atmosphere.

data.title: Awesome Service!
data.text: One of the best sports bars I've been to.  The service was awesome and their food was really good!  We had a table of 14 and the wait staff was very attentive and offered suggestions for food & drinks!

data.title: Game night
data.text: We went here to watch a NBA finals game. The TVs were large and the sound was on, so that was nice! We sat at the bar and ordered onion straws, nachos, fish tacos, etc. All the food was very good. Served hot and quickly, and I'm pretty sure the chips and salsa were homemade. The fish tacos needed more animal sauce, but the bartender brought it right out. We moved to a table (with chalkboard top!) and finished our evening there. I recommend this place as a good gathering place for friends!

data.title: Not what we thought
data.text: Stopped in for a quick drink and an appetizer. The service was good and friendly, but the food was not impressive. We order the chips and dip app. For $8 we got broken up ruffles and what appeared to be dip out the jar. Just seemed over priced for what you get.  Not sure if we will be back.

data.title: meeting friends
data.text: First time we have been here.  the waiter was so nice. He was patient with us while we made decisions on what to eat.  He made sure we had everything we needed for a nice dinner and great conversation.

data.title: Terrible!
data.text: Took a half hour to get our food. Cold over cooked French fries, greasy tasting aujus for the French dip with tasteless meat. What happened to the great food from the pub? Had five different people wait on us terrible service!!! Will not go there again!

data.title: 2 THUMBS UP
data.text: Great service, great atmosphere and best of all AWESOME FOOD.  Everything is made fresh, even including the bread.  Large big screens in every direction, with every channel imagined to watch your favorite sporting event.
